* Experience in the engineering or IT industry

title: Digital Workplace Delivery Lead
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We are seeking a hands-on, user-focused technical lead to drive the delivery of end-user technology solutions that empower productivity and enhance employee experience.
   

  

 As the Digital Workplace Delivery Lead, you will be at the forefront of bridging strategic vision with real-world execution — leading digital workplace initiatives, designing scalable Microsoft 365 solutions, and ensuring seamless collaboration across IT and business teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
**Productivity Solutions Delivery**
* Design and implement Microsoft 365-based solutions and other productivity tools (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Miro, Power Platform, Copilot, etc)
* Translate business needs into secure, scalable, and user-friendly technology solutions.
* Automate and optimize processes using low-code/no-code platforms.
* Develop and maintain reusable templates, automation flows, and supporting documentation.


**Project Leadership**
* Lead and deliver digital workplace and IT operations projects with a strong user experience focus.
* Serve as both project manager and technical lead — coordinating stakeholders, timelines, and resources.
* Ensure secure, timely, and effective implementation of new solutions and services.
* Technical Expertise & Execution
* Provide subject matter expertise in Microsoft 365 productivity tools, with a strong emphasis on user enablement.
* Collaborate with infrastructure and security teams on integration points such as Intune, Autopilot, Entra ID, and device lifecycle management.
* Maintain alignment with IT governance, compliance, and security frameworks.


**Cross-Team Collaboration & Governance**
* Work closely with Digital Workplace Engagement Partner to drive adoption and user engagement.
* Support strategic planning and continuous improvement for the digital workplace.
* Develop frameworks and governance models to scale best practices across the organization.
* Use data and insights to improve digital tools and the end-user experience.
* Documentation & Knowledge Sharing
* Create and maintain technical guides, onboarding materials, and how-to documentation.
* Share knowledge across teams and contribute to internal training for power users and IT.
* Promote a culture of continuous learning.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience delivering Microsoft 365-based workplace solutions.
* Strong project management and technical leadership skills.
* Hands-on experience with Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Power Platform, and Microsoft Copilot.
* Working knowledge of endpoint management (Intune, Autopilot), identity/access (Entra ID), and compliance practices.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Strong documentation and knowledge-sharing abilities.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Game Director
company_industry: Software Development, Gambling Facilities and Casinos, and Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Game Director
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden
 



  





**Opportunity Overview** 




 We are a headhunt company based in Vietnam, providing headhunting services for client all over the world, strongly focus on Asia and Europe market.
 



 Our client is well-funded B2B game studio and is building a new team in Sweden. They are building world-class online slot games for regulated global markets. Backed by deep industry experience and a passion for quality, they deliver captivating game experiences that combine cutting-edge design, high performance, and commercial success
 



 As they expand their portfolio and enter new markets, they are seeking a Game Director to take creative leadership across game development and ensure that every title released exceeds expectations in innovation, quality, and market performance.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As Game Director, you will own the creative and gameplay vision across all game productions. From idea generation and game concepting to live tuning and performance review, you will guide and align teams around a clear creative direction. You will collaborate with product, art, math, and development leads to shape the portfolio and raise the bar for originality, engagement, and execution.
 



 This is a senior, hands-on leadership role where game sensibility meets business impact.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 Game Vision & Portfolio Leadership
 


* Define and champion the creative vision and design direction for the slot game portfolio.
* Guide the creation of new game concepts that blend player engagement with market opportunity.
* Build a library of innovative, differentiated games that reflect the brand and excite partners.



 Cross-Disciplinary Creative Direction
 


* Collaborate with Art Directors, Math Designers, Product Owners, and Engineers to turn high-level ideas into fully developed games.
* Ensure thematic consistency, visual quality, and gameplay clarity across all productions.
* Provide feedback at all stages—from early concept to final build—with a focus on polish and player experience.



 Game Quality & Player-Centric Thinking
 


* Ensure every game offers strong engagement loops, intuitive UX, and rewarding features.
* Balance game math, volatility, and mechanics to suit different player types and regional market needs.
* Stay ahead of iGaming trends, competitor titles, and player preferences to maintain creative relevance.



 Team Leadership & Collaboration
 


* Inspire and mentor Game Designers and Creative Producers, raising overall creative output and team cohesion.
* Work closely with the Product Director and Delivery Director to ensure smooth collaboration between creativity and execution.
* Participate in hiring, onboarding, and capability-building for creative functions.



  





**Qualifications & Experience** 



* 10+ years of experience in game design or creative direction, with 5+ years in leadership roles.
* Proven track record directing successful slot games or real-money iGaming products.
* Deep understanding of gameplay systems, player psychology, and slot design frameworks.
* Strong creative portfolio demonstrating high-quality game design, theming, and player-first thinking.
* Strong grasp of cross-functional development cycles in an Agile environment.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills—capable of uniting diverse teams around a single vision.
* Fluent in English; experience in working with international, multicultural teams is essential.
* Based in Sweden or open to relocation.



**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience in F2P/mobile games with live ops and monetization mechanics.
* Background in working with platform partners, operators, or regulatory bodies (GLI, MGA, etc.).
* Passion for innovation in UX, storytelling, or feature evolution within the iGaming space.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Competitive salary & performance bonuses – Your impact drives rewards.
* Creative freedom & supportive culture – Innovate with passionate colleagues.
* High-visibility titles – Build games played by millions worldwide.
* Growth opportunities – Advance with a fast-growing iGaming leader.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Telness Tech is on a mission to simplify and digitize the telecom industry. Our platform powers next-generation mobile providers, from traditional MVNOs to eSIM challengers and non-telecom players looking to embed connectivity into their offerings. With our roots in Stockholm and our sights on a global scale, we’re building the future of telecom—fast, flexible, and customer-first.
   

  

 As we accelerate our growth, we’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to help us become the global leader in #teltech!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Engineer on our Platform Team, you will be responsible for evolving our data platform and tooling for data ingestion, processing, and management. You will play a key role in building a scalable and robust data platform, enabling the company to leverage a wide range of data sources. You will continue to enhance and improve our data platform, which is hosted on AWS, Kubernetes, and Snowflake.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Collaborate with a cross-functional team of skilled engineers to build and enhance our data platform, enabling efficient data collection, processing, access, usability, and monitoring.
* Develop architectural guidelines, solutions, and best practices for data pipelines using AWS and Snowflake.
* Evolve our Data Warehouse and champion our Data, ML, and AI efforts with a strong business focus.
* Optimize the way we manage and work with data across teams, products, platforms, and business in a rapidly growing company.
* Integrate new and existing data sources into our ELT and reverse ETL pipelines.
* Design and build optimal technical solutions for data governance, cataloging, discovery, and access.
* Ensure data quality and reliability by implementing standardized monitoring, CI/CD, and testing practices.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop solutions that align with business objectives.
* Continuously evaluate and adopt new technologies and best practices to enhance our data infrastructure.


 We are scaling up our platform to new markets with dynamic requirements, and you will play a crucial role in shaping, designing, and building fundamental components. As the company expands, you will help us tackle new and interesting challenges, scaling our platform from tens of thousands to hundreds of millions of users.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Table**
* 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer working in a modern tech environment with data infrastructure, systems architecture, and AWS technologies.
* Proficiency in Snowflake SQL and Snowflake functionality
* Experience and understanding of fundamental design principles for Data Warehouse (Bill Inmon, Kimball).
* Experience with Data Modeling (conceptual/logical/physical) and Ensemble modeling (Data Vault, Focal, Anchor) and Dimension Modeling.
* Experience designing and building robust, production-grade data pipelines.
* Skilled in a high-level programming language such as Python or Go.
* Familiar with Kubernetes and infrastructure as code tools like Terraform.
* Understanding of data security and compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, PII handling).
* Solid grounding in software engineering best practices: version control, CI/CD, testing, and documentation.
* Strong communicator and collaborator, with the ability to solve complex technical problems as part of a team.
* Self-motivated and autonomous, with a drive to improve systems and processes continuously.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.


**Why Telness Tech?**
 We’re not building for telco as it is—we’re building for how it should be: fast-moving, easy to use, and built for the people who use it. At Telness Tech, you’ll join a curious, ambitious, and transparent team. We work hard, we move fast, and we support each other every step of the way.
   

  

 Here’s what you can expect:
   

  

* Be part of an exciting startup journey with strong funding and international expansion.
* Play an active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’ll be encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities for both Telness Tech and your development.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that fosters collaboration and constructive challenge.
* Free daily breakfast, regular "Friday" AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid/remote work setup with an office in central Stockholm.


 Sounds like your challenge? Let’s talk.
   

  

*Currently, we are unable to support work permits or relocation.*
****Due to the Swedish summer vacation period, incoming applications won’t be processed until the first week of August.****

title: QA Lead
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

 As a
 **QA Lead** 
 , you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and stability of our life-changing assistive communication solutions. You will lead the charge in testing both manual and automated solutions for our web-based and installed applications, enabling individuals with disabilities to communicate and engage with the world.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and product managers to uphold and elevate the user experience through robust QA practices. This role is both hands-on and strategic, balancing test execution with leadership and coaching to drive quality at every stage of development.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead and execute manual test plans across platforms, including web and device-based applications.
* Identify opportunities for automation and drive the implementation of efficient, reliable test coverage.
* Maintain and evolve existing test suites, collaborating with stakeholders to align on quality metrics.
* Support a quality-first culture by mentoring developers and QA engineers in best practices.
* Analyze test execution data and report meaningful insights to improve product quality and development cycles.
* Partner closely with software development teams to understand product features and test accordingly.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 7 years of QA experience, including 3+ years in a lead or mentorship role.
* Proven experience with both manual testing and test automation across modern technology stacks.
* A strong grasp of testing strategy, prioritization, and quality metrics.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate test outcomes, risks, and recommendations.
* A collaborative and hands-on mindset with the ability to influence teams toward quality-driven practices.
* A degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).


**Bonus Points For:**
* Experience or familiarity with testing in .NET / C# and Azure environments. While not a requirement, this would be valuable as many of our applications are built in .NET and run on Azure.
* Experience working with assistive communication technologies or Picture Communication Symbols (PCS).
* A keen eye for detail and the ability to reproduce complex issues reliably.
* Familiarity with Agile development practices and CI/CD pipelines.
* Passion for inclusive technology and a desire to contribute to a mission-driven organization.


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Enterprise Architect – Digital Transformation

Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.

 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in 100+ cities with over 275+ MILLION rides to date. It has been an amazing journey and we have no intention of stopping now!**
**To be able to reach our mission - we need great problem solvers onboard (yes, talking to all Backend Engineers out there).**
**At Voi, you won’t just be working with the latest technology - you’ll shape the product we put out on the streets. You’ll have the opportunity to work with a wide range of engineering; from designing the vehicle, soldering the IoT hardware, creating the communication protocol, developing the tech foundation, innovating on the app and finally operating all this as a whole.**
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer you’re a part of a cross functional team with highly skilled Mobile Engineers, UX Designers and Product professionals. You’ll play a key role in Voi’s continued growth and success. Your responsibility is to build features that engage and empower our users and drive the app experience forward. This will include:
   

  

* Build and design scalable and reliable backend for our various products
* Work closely with peer teams (data, mobile, IoT, design, ML, product), and business partners (marketing, repairing services, logistics)
* Large scale data processing to understand user behavior and help define new product features
* Be creative and drive new ideas regarding architecture, tools, products and languages


**What You Need To Embark**
 We use Golang, but there is no requirement for previous experience in that language. We believe that good engineers can switch and learn new languages and technologies. To have the best start with us at Voi, we believe you have:
   

  

* 3+ years of experience as a Senior Engineer building and designing scalable and reliable backend
* Good communication skills and see collaboration as a key to success
* Experience writing well-structured, testable, reliable, efficient and easily maintainable code
* Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and effectively
* Used to work with cloud infrastructure (GCP, AWS or Azure)
* Experience in building systems with microservices architecture
* Experience of working in diverse and cross functional teams towards a common goal


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Teknikinformatör med intresse för ny teknologi
description:
Söker du efter en ny utmaning och vill skapa moderna informationslösningar med användaren i fokus? Hos oss på Aleido får du möjlighet att ta nästa steg inom teknikinformation tillsammans med våra kunder på deras digitaliseringsresa.
   

  

 Gå med i vårt team och hjälp oss att forma framtiden genom att utforska nya metoder och de senaste AI-innovationerna för att överbrygga klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som använder den. Om du har en passion för teknologi och en oändlig nyfikenhet att ständigt lära dig mer, är Aleido platsen för dig.
   

  

**Vad rollen innebär**
 I rollen som teknikinformatör kommer du bland annat:
   

  

* Samla in, analysera, strukturera och producera teknisk information för våra kunders produkter.
* Driva dokumentations- och kundprojekt tillsammans med Aleidos team och säkerställa leveranser av konsekvent, uppdaterad och tillgänglig dokumentation.
* Kartlägga och analysera våra kunders produkter och behov, och utifrån det utveckla deras nuvarande informationsstruktur.
* Hjälpa våra kunder med att förbereda inför deras digitaliseringsresa, samt proaktivt bidra med förbättringsförslag så att kunden får ut så mycket som möjligt av olika informationslösningar.


**Vem du är**
* Har ett par års erfarenhet som teknikinformatör.
* Har vana av att använda XML-baserade verktyg.
* Har erfarenhet av topic-baserat skrivande.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från kognitionsvetenskap, UX och/eller teknisk bakgrund inom hård- eller mjukvara.


 Du som person har en utmärkt känsla för struktur samt gillar att se till de små detaljerna som tillsammans gör stor skillnad för slutprodukten. Du har lätt för att identifiera lösningar och har en utvecklad förmåga att förenkla komplex information. Vi tror vidare att du trivs mycket bra i rollen som konsult och ser det som en naturlig del att få vara med att bidra till att vidareutveckla vårt erbjudande i pågående kunduppdrag. Vi hoppas även att ditt intresse för teknik gör att du håller dig ajour med de nya teknologier inom branschen, som exempelvis AI. Slutligen räds du inte nya utmaningar och trivs i en roll med flera kontaktytor där du får vara drivande i ditt eget arbete.
   

  

**Varför Aleido?**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du arbeta med de senaste AI- och teknologitrenderna, i en kultur som värderar ständig utveckling och lärande.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi har en progressiv distansarbetsmodell som ger dig friheten att balansera arbetslivet på ett sätt som passar dig.
* Utveckling i fokus: Vi erbjuder en lärandekultur där du ständigt utmanas och har möjlighet att växa. Vårt löfte om lärande innebär att vi delar kunskap generöst och värdesätter din strävan att växa.
* Hållbar framtid: Vår vision är att skapa tekniska lösningar som är både innovativa och hållbara.


**Vilka vi är**
 Aleido är ett internationellt företag med lång tradition av att driva utvecklingen av eftermarknadsinformation och utbildningslösningar. Våra kunder utvecklar komplexa produkter eller system, eller söker kunskap och beredskap för att skapa varaktig förändring, inom en mängd branscher såsom fordon, telekom, industri, järnväg och medicinteknik. Vi är närmare tusen kollegor i fem länder. Tillsammans överbryggar vi klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som är beroende av den – genom att göra det avancerade lätt att förstå.

title: Network Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced **Network Engineer** with proven expertise in **Cisco router installation and configuration**. The ideal candidate will be responsible for deploying, configuring, and maintaining network infrastructure to ensure optimal performance, security, and reliability.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Install, configure, and maintain Cisco routers and related network equipment.
* Perform network setup, upgrades, and troubleshooting for LAN/WAN environments.
* Ensure proper connectivity, security, and performance tuning of network devices.
* Conduct site surveys and prepare installation plans for network hardware.
* Collaborate with IT teams to design and implement network solutions.
* Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues.
* Maintain accurate network documentation and asset records.
* Ensure compliance with company IT policies and security standards.

**Requirements:**

* Diploma/Degree in Networking, Computer Science, or related field.
* 4+ years’ experience as a Network Engineer or similar role.
* Hands-on experience with **Cisco router installation and configuration**.
* Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, VLANs, routing protocols (OSPF, EIGRP, BGP), and network security.
* Experience with switches, firewalls, and wireless technologies is an asset.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: 1 900,00kr - 2 000,00kr per day

Work Location: On the road

title: HR Generalist - HRIS & People Operations

description:

 , a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.
   

 Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a
 **HR Generalist - HRIS & People Operations** 
 for our office in

 .
   




**What's in it for you?**

 Make your mark in a high-growth, international company where HR is a strategic partner.
   

 Get hands-on with leading HR tech platforms and bring data-driven decision-making to life.
   

 Join a collaborative, high-paced team where your voice, ideas, and initiatives matter.

 to every interaction.

 in generalist or HR operations roles, ideally in

 , international, or FMCG-style environments.

 HiBOB is a big plus; Eletive and Sana Labs are also a bonus.

title: IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Architects who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects! We develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying our technical know-how, experience in IT projects, and analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, engineering, or a related field
* have approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting or software development (part or full time)
* know that modern tools such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords, but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* have broad technical expertise and interest in technology trends
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating their capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* Manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be in charge of the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements such as cyber resilience
* Analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:

**Om rollen**
 Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
* Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
* Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
* Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
* Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på
 **kompetensutveckling** 
 , där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:
   

  

* Generös kompetensutveckling
* Attraktiv lönemodell
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


**Om B3**
 B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Lidia, för denna tjänst på lidia.hagos@b3.se.

title: Client Technical Director - Nordic - Strategic Accounts (Sweden)
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
We’re in an unbelievably exciting area of tech and are fundamentally reshaping the data storage industry. Here, you lead with innovative thinking, grow along with us, and join the smartest team in the industry.
   

  

 This type of work—work that changes the world—is what the tech industry was founded on. So, if you're ready to seize the endless opportunities and leave your mark, come join us.
   

  

 If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
   

  

 You keep up with the latest trends, are a disruptive thinker and have experience of driving cultural change in organisations? The Strategic Accounts business is the growth area for Pure and the Client Technical Director (CTD), known internally as a - Consulting System Engineer (CSE) - is a key role in engaging Automotive and Manufacturing clients in conversations about their technology needs to help them in their transformation to embrace Digital business.
   

  

 As Client Technical Director you typically are a senior level technical Solutions Architect who will work with and focus on Pure’s Strategic clients. In turn, you will also work in collaboration with Pure’s Enterprise and Field pre-sales and account teams. As CTD you also have a great grasp of IT industry trends, broad and deep IT industry experience (especially Automotive and Manufacturing) and a high degree of business acumen and will be working in the forefront of Pure’s global sales capability.
   

  

 As a CTD you will be required to work closely with your customer base, building a trusted relationship, identifying and quantifying outcome based opportunities that can be delivered from our portfolio.
   

  

 You must be knowledgeable across industry, business, IT strategy and technology domains and be comfortable presenting to C-Suite clients, discussing process with business managers or working with developers on solution strategy, architecture and code, and with storage admins designing operating models – from boardroom to hackathon to storage ops. Critically you will be accustomed to creating a value proposition that is directly linked to a client’s business model, challenges and issues plus their future vision.
   

  

 You will be an expert in quickly learning new business models and drivers and will be able to articulate, to multiple customer stakeholder personas across different regions and countries. This will include presenting and explaining the benefits and differentiators of our chosen technology, how our solution has been mapped to meet their industry, business and operational requirements, our implementation methods, and the proposed commercial and financial models.
   

  

 Building and articulating financial and commercial models with their benefits to our customers, and internal stakeholders is a key aspect of the ever evolving CTD role.
   

  

 It is expected that the CTD will be able to translate our core values, differentiators and capabilities across our portfolio, plus articulate previous customer success stories, benefits seen and acknowledged by customers with known outcomes to multiple levels of stakeholders within the strategic accounts.
   

  

 You have gravitas and authenticity. You will be expected to have first class interpersonal skills combined with a comfortable, open and compelling communication and presentation style. You also bring a high degree of diplomacy and a strong EQ. It is imperative that we can look at our value propositions from the viewpoint of our customers, therefore empathy is critical.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE, AS A CTD AT PURE YOU WILL...**
**1** 
**: Solution Definition:**
* Define end-to-end solutions, encompassing industry and business approaches, implementation methods, technology usage, and influence commercial and financial models.
* Stakeholder Management:
* Understand stakeholders, their drivers, challenges, their goals and expectations, and effectively communicate the right messages to them. You will spend a large portion of your time with your customers, partners and key stakeholders.
* Financial Acumen:
* Calculate Total Cost of Ownership scenarios for customers, explaining how they align with their challenges and Pure's benefits.
* Leadership and Collaboration:
* Lead large IT projects, establish yourself as a thought leader and trusted advisor, collaborate with sales, engineering, and product management teams.
* Collateral Production:
* Create client collateral, including presentations, papers, demonstrations, proofs of concepts, and contribute to joint offerings with other Pure teams.
* Sales Guidance:
* Guide the sales team in delivering optimal technology solutions in a competitive environment.
* Technical Leadership:
* Provide technical leadership and mentoring for the SE organization, engage in field marketing events.
* Market Insight:
* Identify key trends, map customer challenges with Pure Storage’s technology strategy, predict long-term competitive trends.
* Cultural Maintenance:
* Help maintain the company's technical culture, retain and attract top technical talent.


**What You’ll Need To Excel In This Role...**
* Technical Expertise:
* Strong technical prowess across storage, compute, database, networking, virtualization, and emerging technologies. A strong infrastructure background with a considerable knowledge in data management and storage technologies.
* Versatility:
* Technical understanding in data science, modern IT architecture modelling, Agile application development, DevOps, automation principles, infrastructure operations, project management, and IT security.
* Strategic Thinking:
* Combine big-thinking strategic perspective with a detail-oriented approach to problem-solving.
* Communication Skills:
* Outstanding communication skills, able to articulate complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. Be able to build that trusted relationship with your customers.
* Industry Knowledge:
* Understand commercial and disruptive technology trends in the client’s market and interpret their implications for target solutions. This will include a deep appreciation and understanding of technical operations in large enterprise customers (with an extra level of focus and experience in Global Automotive and Manufacturing customers) You will know your competitors, their strengths and weaknesses and how to articulate Pure’s differentiators and advantages to your customers for the right use cases.
* Learning Orientation:
* Embrace lifelong learning, with approximately 10% of time dedicated to training and participation in industry conferences.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* Pure Innovation: We celebrate those who think critically, like a challenge and aspire to be trailblazers.
* Pure Growth: We give you the space and support to grow along with us and to contribute to something meaningful. We have been Named Fortune's Best Large Workplaces in the Bay Area™, Fortune's Best Workplaces for Millennials™ and certified as a Great Place to Work®!
* Pure Team: We build each other up and set aside ego for the greater good.


 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources and company-sponsored team events. Check out purebenefits.com for more information.
   

  

**Accommodations And Accessibility**
 Candidates with disabilities may request accommodations for all aspects of our hiring process. For more on this, contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com if you’re invited to an interview.
   

  

**Our Commitment To a Strong And Inclusive Team**
 We’re forging a future where everyone finds their rightful place and where every voice matters. Where uniqueness isn’t just accepted but embraced. That’s why we are committed to fostering the growth and development of every person, cultivating a sense of community through our Employee Resource Groups and advocating for inclusive leadership.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.

title: Virtualiseringsspecialist inom VMware - Castra
description:
**Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.**
**Rollen**
 I rollen som virtualiseringsspecialist så kommer du arbeta med att med installation, konfiguration, felsökning och underhåll/prestanda-optimering av virtualiseringsplattformen VMware. Arbetet innefattar att analysera, strukturera, föreslå, vidareutveckla och implementera den infrastruktur och tjänster som matchar organisationens behov. Du kommer även säkerställa att infrastrukturen stödjer den arkitekturella målbilden. Vidare kommer du att arbeta löpande med med behovsinsamling, omvärldsbevakning och prioriteringar.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av virtualisering av VMware-plattformen såväl som arbete med IT-infrastruktur och datacenter.
* Har gedigen kunskap inom Vmware och Vmwareprodukter som (NSX-T, NSX-V, vSAN, vSphere, ESXI, ESX, vRealize etc).
* Minst 8 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av VMware
* Goda kunskaper om bland annat patchning, övervakning, backup/restore m.m
* Goda kunskaper om Windows Powershell och/eller andra scriptspråk


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft såsom MCSA, MCSE eller liknande
* Certifieringar inom Veeam, Red hat eller liknande


**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Sundsvall, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Global RGM Manager (Nordics)
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
Karo Healthcare, a dynamic and growing personal-care retail company, is all about making smart choices for everyday healthcare. With a wide-ranging portfolio across seven categories including medical products, we own and sell over 80 brands in about 90 countries. Our portfolio includes such brands as E45, Pevaryl, Lamisil, Nutravita, Decubal and many others. Our core belief in empowering people to make intelligent health decisions drives our growth strategy, blending organic expansion and M&A.
 



**Join us at Karo Healthcare on our exciting journey. We're currently looking for a Global RGM Manager (Nordics) for our office in Stockholm or Oslo.**



**What's in it for you?**

**Step into a pivotal regional role that offers real ownership, strategic impact, and visibility across markets. You'll help shape Karo's commercial future, working across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland - all within a fast-moving, international company that values bold thinking and hands-on action.**



**What you'll be doing**

 As Global RGM Manager for the Nordics, you'll play a central role in accelerating our Revenue Growth Management (RGM) capabilities and mindset locally - making data-driven decisions that unlock profitable growth. Reporting to the Global RGM Director, you will:
 


* Act as a strategic business partner to Nordic commercial teams, embedding RGM best practices in four key markets.
* Drive revenue and gross margin improvements, tracked both in absolute terms and as a percentage of sales.
* Deploy global pricing analytics tools to shape long-term pricing strategy and agile short-term actions.
* Lead campaign analytics to assess promotional ROI, steer improvements, and enhance store-level execution.
* Review and report on Trade Investment, aligning it to market structures and maximizing ROI with SMART goals.
* Provide regular analysis of brand/category performance, identifying risks and uncovering new opportunities.
* Support the Nordic Stars Squad on price/pack architecture projects for two leading regional brands.
* Work cross-functionally with commercial, brand, sales, analytics, and insight teams across multiple markets.
  

  


**Requirements**
* Minimum 3 years of in-market RGM experience, ideally within FMCG or healthcare.
* Proven financial acumen: you understand how to grow revenue and profit from both customer and brand owner perspectives.
* Strong command of market data and analytics to build commercially sound, customer-centric strategies.
* High numerical and analytical reasoning skills.
* Advanced Excel skills and solid MS Office proficiency; Power BI experience is a plus.
* Strong communication, influencing, and relationship-building skills across functions and geographies.
* Experience with Trade Promotions Management is advantageous.
* Fluent in English; able to work independently and drive initiatives across borders.
  



 If you're looking to shape strategy, gain international exposure, and truly make a difference in a growing, purpose-driven organization, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  




**Benefits**
* Opportunity to create, grow, and encourage
* Apart from a competitive salary pack, there are lots of growth opportunities to meet your personal ambitions
* Flexible schedule and life work balance
* Responsibility for exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industry
* Very positive work environment in a young, international, and motivated team
* Start-up spirit while being a part of the large international organization with strong values
  



 Karo Healthcare has a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We are looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.

title: Consulting Solutions Executive
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Meet Our Team**
 As part of Pegasystems' consulting organization, the Consulting Solution Executive has responsibilities of the professional services business development & contracting process, advising on Pega Success and maintaining C-class or senior management engagement for delivery success. The team makes a key contribution in driving License sales success in collaboration with the broader go-to-market organisation.
   

  

**Picture Yourself At Pega**
 This is a high-profile and demanding role, requiring a combination of analytical skills, thought leadership, project/ process management, and cross-functional collaboration skills. This role is designed to help Pega grow its software and services business; provide high quality services to its clients, partners and employees; and help develop a delivery infrastructure for rapid growth. This role will be working with several high profile and complex client engagements.
   

  

**What You'll Do At Pega**
* Lead work efforts, execute and grow Consulting billings across designated vertical with high profile and complex clients
* Achieve annual quota license by supporting software sales of our insert vertical.
* Advocate during the sales process for best practice delivery approach to be followed on all Pega projects.
* Lead the efforts to define, scope, size and propose new Pega application implementations to clients
* Provide field feedback to the product management and engineering teams responsible for Pega applications
* Develop and maintain deep client contacts as assigned.
* Achieve and maintain assigned Certifications and needed credentials.


**Who You Are**
 You have proven experience in professional services business development, as well as experience selling or implementing adjust for vertical. You are a natural, fast-paced learner able to turn out solutions of your own initiative, and you are comfortable positioning yourself as an educator equipped to offer large accounts practical solutions to relevant industry problems. You can speak with confidence and clarity and can hold gravitas in conversations with C-suite executives or VPs of Marketing. This is a position for someone who is a goal-driven, challenge-seeking performer.
   

  

**What You've Accomplished**
* BA/BS (Business or Technical Degree preferred)
* 10+ years of experience in a professional services business development role
* Proven to be successful in defining and contracting consulting engagements including the selling process
* Multi stakeholder management.
* Ability to persuade and influence, using appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to gain acceptance of thoughts, plans, activities, services and products
* Ability to achieve role based Pega certifications
* Ability to complete Industry Specific Training as required


**Pega Offers You**
* Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
* A very strong ambitious high performing team
* Continuous learning and development opportunities
* An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
* Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay plus bonus incentive & employee equity in the company

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into customer-oriented, digital contracts that feel like magic.** 




  





 We now need an experienced
 *Engineering Manager* 
 to keep our development organisation firing on all cylinders. You will guide a community of developers through hiring, onboarding, coaching and performance development, while collaborating with Product Managers, Product Designer, Developers, Tech Leads and other Engineering Managers to plan, build and maintain the Oneflow platform. In a company that values initiative, your technical expertise and leadership will directly influence our product and the people who craft it.
 



  





**Here’s how you’ll make an impact** 




  




* You will coach, mentor and grow a community of developers, creating an environment where everyone delivers their best work and advance in their careers.
* You will help translate roadmap initiatives into clear technical initiatives, guide the teams through discovery and execution and hold the bar on code quality, security and operational excellence.
* You bring credibility through code, whether reviewing critical PRs, shaping architecture decisions or jumping in to unblock a release, you are comfortable working in modern stacks.
* You drive continuous improvements by introducing metrics, refining processes and champion automation enabling teams to reach a high deployment frequency every sprint.
* You align our technical direction with others Engineering Managers, Tech Leads and non technical stakeholders across the company.



  





**Your background** 




  




* At least 5 years of professional software development experience, including system design and end-to-end ownership in production, with a focus on either Python or React.
* A minimum of 5 years leading developers in an agile, product-focused setting, including hiring, coaching and performance management.
* Full-cycle mindset spanning discovery, architecture, coding standards, observability, CI/CD and incident response.
* Outcome oriented approach that balances speed and quality, sets measurable goals (we use OKRs) and delivers results.
* People first leadership style marked by clear communication, actionable feedback and an inclusive, psychologically safe culture.
* Experience with integrations, security best practices (OWASP, encryption) or scaling B2B SaaS products.



  





**Come work with us** 




  





 We value gender equality and diversity in organisation, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we currently have 34 nationalities and are proud of an extremely diverse workplace. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



  





 The recruitment process begins with an interview with Aleksandra from the Talent Acquisition team. Next, you will complete a personality and logic test, followed by a meeting with the hiring managers. Finally, you will prepare for an assignment and participate in a case interview.
 



  





**We can’t wait to meet you! 🎉** 




  





 Visit our website for more information about our product and Oneflow. Visit our career page for more information about our culture and future colleagues. 💜

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
B3 Link, en del av B3-koncernen, utmärker oss genom vår djupa systemutvecklingskompetens och förmåga att leverera kompletta lösningar för våra kunder. Vi kombinerar även avancerad AI-teknik med en förståelse för affärsbehov och tar ansvar för hela utvecklingsprocessen. Vår styrka ligger i att skapa hållbara och skalbara lösningar som stödjer kundens verksamhet och långsiktiga mål.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Teamet i Stockholm/Uppsala består av ett gäng kollegor med kompetens inom både backend, frontend och fullstack, vilka nu söker sin nästa kollega! Att vara konsult på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom systemutveckling Java, .Net eller Python
* Arbetat med cloud-teknologier
* Arbetat med microservices
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Extra glada blir vi om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps
* Erfarenhet av moderna frontend-ramverk
* Intresse av AI teknik


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på
 **kompetensutveckling** 
 , där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:
   

  

* Generös kompetensutveckling
